comments.body: I like this idea for biomes that generate at higher y levels then suddenly drop 50 blocks to an ocean. It would make the terrain look much better.
Great idea
In the newest snapshot there are lots of really deep gullies with rivers at the bottom, and ruined bridges would make a lot of sense.
I also think lowering the ocean floor at some points to fit with the new map height would be awesome.

It's a nice idea, but I don't know if it's feasible. So far all items have take the same time to get smelted, and that seems to be hard-coded into the game. It would be nice to have variety, but giving different items more or less time to get smelted might be a whole long technical process that they don't really have time for in 1.18. May be in another update? Who knows.

I think this could be balanced with the following conditions for the smelting: it'll take 6 times longer per block verse a single raw and the XP return is the same as if you smelted a single raw. This would mean you have to wait longer (but still faster than smelting an individual raw ore) and you'd get less XP in return for a full raw ore block. Fuel consumption is done per item as I recall so balancing it is going to have to based on the XP reward and how many ticks it takes to smelt the item. So while you would get more iron/gold/copper faster/ingot, it's less of an XP reward so players and prioritized based on which is more important fast iron, or getting some XP easily.
The obvious reason is they are too big to fit in the furnace.

I think, that smelting raw ore blocks should become full blocks of the material.

Short comment but ok.

As another thing add in squirrels and they enter breeding with pinecones, just to give the same level of functions as an apple, or allow pinecones to be throwable like eggs, and only provided a bit of knockback.

They could be used to make Brown Dye or something...

(Btw, Scientifically speaking, they would be Spruce Cones, not Pine Cones. Since they drop from Spruce trees, not Pine Trees... but Pine Cone sounds better).
That would awesome be cool because then you can have a good time destroying mobs

I think it would be REALY cool, but it would have to be pretty hard, like

 

                     G IB G

                     Di AS DI

                     CB AS CB

 

 

G=GOLD  DI=DIAMOND  AS=AMETHYST SHARD  CB=COPPER BLOCK  IB=IRON

Or it could be upgraded with enchantments or some kind of runes. Like fire, ice, wither, and ender.

Only one could be applied.

I think the trade should be added to stonemasons. I don't think it would even be that hard to add it to 1.17.2. In 1.18 though, I think it should be possible to get cobbled deepslate similar to how cobblestone is obtained. Deepslate is a very nice building material and it's just a bummer that it's grindy to get enough deepslate to make huge builds.
How bout cobblestone + coal = deepslate

I really like this idea! 

What I would like to see is different ambience depending on the biome.
Nice idea! Mojang  should too delete  spooky cave sounds!
I'm unsure on the idea of spider queens, but I definitely like the idea of nests of webs and loot. Maybe it could come with some spooky new blocks too!
I agree. We all understand that a spawner is a "crutch".
Plus boats can handle it i guess.

I feel like this is all that new world generation is missing. The rivers sometimes feel very contrasting and rare for the hilly new world generation. Also, would love to see water falls in caves, when aquifers and cave intersect, they shouldn’t put stone in the way, just let the water flow out into the cave like a waterfall
expand the mineshafts!

This looks really unrelated to the theme of the Deep Dark biome itself. I think what you meant is a biome seperate to the Deep Dark that only generates below Y-0 in the Deepslate layers. A lot of people are confused about this. The Deep Dark is a biome of its own that only generates in the negative Y-levels. It doesn't occupy the entirety of the Deepslate level, so it's not the only biome that generates there. And it is indeed a biome, not a "region", "zone" or "structure". This has been confirmed repeatedly.
yeah ik but I couldn’t think of good name so is Shadow Forest good enough for you? Also ran out of space to include mobs

Yeah, Shadow Forest sounds good. Nice biome concept by the way! I could see it fitting in various environments. May be even The End, with Carnivorous plants being Chorus Plant based? Seems like more a fit there to me personally.
Do you think I should rename hanging vine to tentacle vine
Yeah sounds good as well.
This is great idea bro!!!
That would be really cool because the warden was designed after disc 11 but also if you kill it the warden should release the soul trapped inside of it.
Nobody ever said the Warden was "designed after" disc 11. This is pure speculation.
Lore-wise, this makes tons of sense

Actually, Mojang did say that the Warden was based off the unknown monster from disc 11. I’ve noticed a lot of their decisions with the deepslate layer and the deep dark have been focused on keeping that mystery element to the whole thing. That’s why they renamed Grimstone. They said it made it too obviously evil sounding.

Darius Dandeneau, no they did not directly say so. Sure, they want to keep a mystery element to all of it, which is exactly why they didn't directly state that the monster in Disc 11 is the Warden. Kingbdogz directly said in an Ask Mojang video that it is not necessarily based on that monster. He never rejected nor confirmed that proposition. Mojang almost never directly reveals any of the lore elements of the game to us. 90% of the time, it's all up to our interpretation. I'd even go as far as to say that they don't keep a specific lore timeline or sequence when designing features, but rather add lore elements along the way as they're updating the game to keep players theorizing and wondering more. A lot of the time we see people like Jeb saying that they don't know if a certain lore theory is true, and I'd argue that all of this is genuine. None of them know! They just create the little threads that players could connect together in any way and from any perspective they want, without even connecting those threads themselves in the first place. They don't know the story cuz there is no fixed story! They never made one! The players are the ones who make the stories. There is no fixed lore sequence to reveal; it's all up to you.
Perhaps as a 0.1% chance drop. That way you feel more rewarded when you get it.
It is coming in 1.18 this holiday. The update was split, and they said the Deep Dark and all of its features are coming along with the new world generation in 1.18.
Warden should drop warden scales and it can be applied to diamond and Netherite armour and also the elytra using the smithing table and it should add 1 protection. It should have 5% drop rate
Warden should drop warden scales and it can be applied to diamond and Netherite armour and also the elytra using the smithing table and it should add 1 protection. It should have 5% drop rate
I hope mi idea is good
Immediately when I saw the name of your post, I immediately thought of the Arkenstone. However, the Arkenstone is worthless compared to the Silmarils. Though the Arkenstone is still pretty valuable.
Doors don't work that way, though

While being an interesting concept, the RTS is a server wide variable; so if you were to use something like this in a multiplayer server, you'd be changing not just the tick speed for yourself, but everyone else as well; and that may cause changes in variables or events that players may have for their redstone contraptions.

Neat idea; but in practice could be very disruptive or dangerous.
Yes I was thinking about this. How about it just makes crops grow faster, animals grow up faster, zombie villagers cure faster and makes other things happen faster in a short radius?
you could use shears to show what creature it is!
It could look something similar to the warden, perhaps being some related species, but also have some axolotl traits to make the allusion more strongly implied.
I like that idea, it would be great for rp and just a cool feature that people will find and think 'oh cool!' +1

How do you know that they'd be perfectly fine? They clearly have ideas for candes (possibly related to the Deep Dark) that wouldn't make sense to implement as an update. Be patient, six months are not the biggest deal, besides that they definitely have a reason to delay them despite them seeming fine to you.

1.17 should add candles, seeing as they are craftable with honeycomb and string, and not exclusive to the "deep dark" biome. Unless they plan on having some kind of secret un-announced use related to that, I don't see any reason why they would need to wait to add them.
Okay, now that they have been re-added... I'm very confused as to why they removed them in the first place.

The Fire on the candles kind of ruin the effect of candles. Its a bit big so maybe a new type of particle effect. Attached is an example of how you could do that.(It is small however it is for in game pixels) also maybe don't have the particle effect follow you around no matter how you look at it.
Hola mogang me prodrias dar la 1.17.40 porfavor
They'd probably have to retexture the Bottles O' Enchantibg, since currently they're a greenish yellow, which is almost the opposite of purple (y'know, since Amethysts are purple).

Plunder I would let you see the full hotbar, next piglin trade,  all non-chest containers, and the first nine slots of a chest/villager inventory, Plunder II would let you see the full hotbar, armor, offhand, craftable items, and the first nine slots of the inventory, as well as the first three rows of a chest, and Plunder III would do everything described in the post.

402383844652

That sounds like a huge improvement :D

Would definitely make Plunder more balanced and interesting
one of the best idea's in a while
BEDROCK FOREVER!!!
I agree and we just really need to be able to hold things in our offhand, period.
